author: g11tech
content: <@159152274659082240> , could you help me finding where geth's trusted setup file is, i think lodestar's and geths differ

author: g11tech
content: want to just copy over and  see if the things match

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> i suspect it's https://github.com/protolambda/go-kzg/blob/master/eth/trusted_setup.json

author: g11tech
content: so its just part of the go-kzg lib?

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> i think since https://github.com/mdehoog/go-ethereum/pull/59 that's the case

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> seems like #59 strips out the geth-specific trusted setup and inherits the go-kzg one. which is introduced here: https://github.com/protolambda/go-kzg/commit/e941ac64dde787324cab1099a2f9e8dd6b401acc#diff-accaf0d1cf514f50e76f5152c6642b7623b52a3bf2069603d6d6f12d247a58daR43

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> that's based on some rudimentary checking. good luck! :)

author: terencechain

Let me know if there's any questions. I'll work on sync today. Saw a few subscription errors. I think we still need some work there

author: g11tech
content: i think there is again bug introduced in the latest commit on this branch, engine api doesnt start at specified engine port

author: g11tech
content: and instead gives this suspicious looking log

author: g11tech
content: where it starts normal eth_ at 8545, closes it and then throws error that port is occupied (no other client is running occupyting the port)

author: g11tech
content: the previous commit of 6 december, worked fine to start the interop

author: inphi
content: thanks for the report. Taking a look.

author: inphi
content: The latest eip-4844 branch merges upstream geth changes. This changes the default behavior of geth a bit. Geth now launches an authenticated RPC server for the engine API. Please ensure that your `--authrpc.port` isn't set to `8545`.

author: inphi
content: (or ensure that the unauthenticated `--http.port` isn't set to  `8545`)
